ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the composition and history of the book of Isaiah.
Gained a better understanding of issues in the compositional history of Isaiah.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish the course had encouraged more discussion and interaction with the texts we were assigned. I also think the course could have benefitted from more structure. As it was, I found it difficult to follow most days, and that impacted what I was able to learn from the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to any student interested in prophetic textual tradition.

I would not. Again, I felt the course lacked structure and was difficult to follow and engage with. I feel as though I just as easily could have gotten the syllabus and just read the assigned texts in order to gain the same level of information.
